00035 /** \defgroup math Math Utilities
00036  * \par
00037  * When converting between continuous and discrete use: \n
00038  * Continuous = Discrete + 0.5         [Reconstruction/Interpolation] \n
00039  * Discrete = Round(Continuous - 0.5)  [Sampling/Quantization] \n
00040  * \par
00041  * Notice that must check min-max limits when converting from Continuous to Discrete.
00042  * \par
00043  * When converting between discrete and discrete use: \n
00044  * integer src_size, dst_len, src_i, dst_i            \n
00045  * real factor = (real)(dst_size)/(real)(src_size)    \n
00046  * dst_i = Round(factor*(src_i + 0.5) - 0.5)
00047  * \par
00048  * See \ref im_math.h
00049  * \ingroup util */
00050 
00051 
00052 /** Round a real to the nearest integer.
00053  * \ingroup math */
00054 inline int imRound(float x) 
00055 {
00056   return (int)(x < 0? x-0.5f: x+0.5f);
00057 }
00058 inline int imRound(double x) 
00059 {
00060   return (int)(x < 0? x-0.5: x+0.5);
00061 }
00062 
00063 template <class T>
00064 inline T imAbs(const T& v)
00065 {
00066   if (v < 0)
00067     return -1*v;
00068   return v;
00069 }
00070 
00071 /** Converts between two discrete grids.
00072  * factor is "dst_size/src_size".
00073  * \ingroup math */
00074 inline int imResampleInt(int x, float factor)
00075 {
00076   float xr = factor*(x + 0.5f) - 0.5f;
00077   return (int)(xr < 0? xr-0.5f: xr+0.5f);  /* Round */
00078 }
00079 
00080 /** Does Zero Order Decimation (Mean).
00081  * \ingroup math */
00082 template <class T, class TU>
00083 inline T imZeroOrderDecimation(int width, int height, T *map, float xl, float yl, float box_width, float box_height, TU Dummy)
00084 {
00085   int x0,x1,y0,y1;
00086   (void)Dummy;
00087 
00088   x0 = (int)floor(xl - box_width/2.0 - 0.5) + 1;
00089   y0 = (int)floor(yl - box_height/2.0 - 0.5) + 1;
00090   x1 = (int)floor(xl + box_width/2.0 - 0.5);
00091   y1 = (int)floor(yl + box_height/2.0 - 0.5);
00092 
00093   if (x0 == x1) x1++;
00094   if (y0 == y1) y1++;
00095 
00096   x0 = x0<0? 0: x0>width-1? width-1: x0;
00097   y0 = y0<0? 0: y0>height-1? height-1: y0;
00098   x1 = x1<0? 0: x1>width-1? width-1: x1;
00099   y1 = y1<0? 0: y1>height-1? height-1: y1;
00100 
00101   TU Value;
00102   int Count = 0;
00103 
00104   Value = 0;
00105 
00106   for (int y = y0; y <= y1; y++)
00107   {
00108     for (int x = x0; x <= x1; x++)
00109     {
00110       Value += map[y*width+x];
00111       Count++;
00112     }
00113   }
00114 
00115   if (Count == 0)
00116   {
00117     Value = 0;
00118     return (T)Value;
00119   }
00120 
00121   return (T)(Value/(float)Count);
00122 }
00123 
00124 /** Does Bilinear Decimation.
00125  * \ingroup math */
00126 template <class T, class TU>
00127 inline T imBilinearDecimation(int width, int height, T *map, float xl, float yl, float box_width, float box_height, TU Dummy)
00128 {
00129   int x0,x1,y0,y1;
00130   (void)Dummy;
00131 
00132   x0 = (int)floor(xl - box_width/2.0 - 0.5) + 1;
00133   y0 = (int)floor(yl - box_height/2.0 - 0.5) + 1;
00134   x1 = (int)floor(xl + box_width/2.0 - 0.5);
00135   y1 = (int)floor(yl + box_height/2.0 - 0.5);
00136 
00137   if (x0 == x1) x1++;
00138   if (y0 == y1) y1++;
00139 
00140   x0 = x0<0? 0: x0>width-1? width-1: x0;
00141   y0 = y0<0? 0: y0>height-1? height-1: y0;
00142   x1 = x1<0? 0: x1>width-1? width-1: x1;
00143   y1 = y1<0? 0: y1>height-1? height-1: y1;
00144 
00145   TU Value, LineValue;
00146   float LineNorm, Norm, dxr, dyr;
00147 
00148   Value = 0;
00149   Norm = 0;
00150 
00151   for (int y = y0; y <= y1; y++)
00152   {
00153     dyr = yl - (y+0.5f);
00154     if (dyr < 0) dyr *= -1;
00155 
00156     LineValue = 0;
00157     LineNorm = 0;
00158 
00159     for (int x = x0; x <= x1; x++)
00160     {
00161       dxr = xl - (x+0.5f);
00162       if (dxr < 0) dxr *= -1;
00163 
00164       LineValue += map[y*width+x] * dxr;
00165       LineNorm += dxr;
00166     }
00167 
00168     Value += LineValue * dyr;
00169     Norm += dyr * LineNorm;
00170   }
00171 
00172   if (Norm == 0)
00173   {
00174     Value = 0;
00175     return (T)Value;
00176   }
00177 
00178   return (T)(Value/Norm);
00179 }

00181 /** Does Zero Order Interpolation (Nearest Neighborhood).
00182  * \ingroup math */
00183 template <class T>
00184 inline T imZeroOrderInterpolation(int width, int height, T *map, float xl, float yl)
00185 {
00186   int x0 = imRound(xl-0.5f);
00187   int y0 = imRound(yl-0.5f);
00188   x0 = x0<0? 0: x0>width-1? width-1: x0;
00189   y0 = y0<0? 0: y0>height-1? height-1: y0;
00190   return map[y0*width + x0];
00191 }
00192 
00193 /** Does Bilinear Interpolation.
00194  * \ingroup math */
00195 template <class T>
00196 inline T imBilinearInterpolation(int width, int height, T *map, float xl, float yl)
00197 {
00198   int x0, y0, x1, y1;
00199   float t, u;
00200 
00201   if (xl < 0.5)
00202   {
00203     x1 = x0 = 0; 
00204     t = 0;
00205   }
00206   else if (xl >= width-0.5)
00207   {
00208     x1 = x0 = width-1;
00209     t = 0;
00210   }
00211   else
00212   {
00213     x0 = (int)(xl-0.5f);
00214     x1 = x0+1;
00215     t = xl - (x0+0.5f);
00216   }
00217 
00218   if (yl < 0.5)
00219   {
00220     y1 = y0 = 0; 
00221     u = 0;
00222   }
00223   else if (yl >= height-0.5)
00224   {
00225     y1 = y0 = height-1;
00226     u = 0;
00227   }
00228   else
00229   {
00230     y0 = (int)(yl-0.5f);
00231     y1 = y0+1;
00232     u = yl - (y0+0.5f);
00233   }
00234 
00235   T fll = map[y0*width + x0];
00236   T fhl = map[y0*width + x1];
00237   T flh = map[y1*width + x0];
00238   T fhh = map[y1*width + x1];
00239 
00240   return (T)((fhh - flh - fhl + fll) * u * t +
00241                          (fhl - fll) * t +
00242                          (flh - fll) * u +
00243                                 fll);
00244 }
00245 
00246 /** Does Bicubic Interpolation.
00247  * \ingroup math */
00248 template <class T, class TU>
00249 inline T imBicubicInterpolation(int width, int height, T *map, float xl, float yl, TU Dummy)
00250 {
00251   int X[4], Y[4];
00252   float t, u;
00253   (void)Dummy;
00254 
00255   if (xl >= width-0.5)
00256   {
00257     X[3] = X[2] = X[1] = width-1;
00258     X[0] = X[1]-1;
00259     t = 0;
00260   }
00261   else
00262   {
00263     X[1] = (int)(xl-0.5f);
00264     if (X[1] < 0) X[1] = 0;
00265 
00266     X[0] = X[1]-1;
00267     X[2] = X[1]+1;
00268     X[3] = X[1]+2;
00269 
00270     if (X[0] < 0) X[0] = 0;
00271     if (X[3] > width-1) X[3] = width-1;
00272 
00273     t = xl - (X[1]+0.5f);
00274   }
00275 
00276   if (yl >= height-0.5)
00277   {
00278     Y[3] = Y[2] = Y[1] = height-1;
00279     Y[0] = Y[1]-1;
00280     u = 0;
00281   }
00282   else
00283   {
00284     Y[1] = (int)(yl-0.5f);
00285     if (Y[1] < 0) Y[1] = 0;
00286 
00287     Y[0] = Y[1]-1;
00288     Y[2] = Y[1]+1;
00289     Y[3] = Y[1]+2;
00290 
00291     if (Y[0] < 0) Y[0] = 0;
00292     if (Y[3] > height-1) Y[3] = height-1;
00293 
00294     u = yl - (Y[1]+0.5f);
00295   }
00296 
00297   float CX[4], CY[4];
00298 
00299   // Optimize calculations
00300   {
00301     float c, c2, c3;
00302 
00303 #define C0 (-c3 + 2.0f*c2 - c)
00304 #define C1 ( c3 - 2.0f*c2 + 1.0f)
00305 #define C2 (-c3 + c2 + c)
00306 #define C3 ( c3 - c2)
00307 
00308     c = t;
00309     c2 = c*c; c3 = c2*c;
00310     CX[0] = C0; CX[1] = C1; CX[2] = C2; CX[3] = C3;
00311 
00312     c = u;
00313     c2 = c*c; c3 = c2*c;
00314     CY[0] = C0; CY[1] = C1; CY[2] = C2; CY[3] = C3;
00315 
00316 #undef C0
00317 #undef C1
00318 #undef C2
00319 #undef C3
00320   }
00321 
00322   TU LineValue, Value;
00323   float LineNorm, Norm;
00324 
00325   Value = 0;
00326   Norm = 0;
00327 
00328   for (int y = 0; y < 4; y++)
00329   {
00330     LineValue = 0;
00331     LineNorm = 0;
00332 
00333     for (int x = 0; x < 4; x++)
00334     {
00335       LineValue += map[Y[y]*width+X[x]] * CX[x];
00336       LineNorm += CX[x];
00337     }
00338 
00339     Value += LineValue * CY[y];
00340     Norm += CY[y] * LineNorm;
00341   }
00342 
00343   if (Norm == 0)
00344   {
00345     Value = 0;
00346     return (T)Value;
00347   }
00348 
00349   Value = (Value/Norm);
00350 
00351   int size = sizeof(T); 
00352   if (size == 1)
00353     return (T)(Value<=(TU)0? (TU)0: Value<=(TU)255? Value: (TU)255);
00354   else
00355     return (T)(Value);
00356 }

00358 /** Calculates minimum and maximum values.
00359  * \ingroup math */
00360 template <class T> 
00361 inline void imMinMax(const T *map, int count, T& min, T& max, int abssolute = 0)
00362 {
00363   if (abssolute)
00364     min = imAbs(map[0]);
00365   else
00366     min = map[0];
00367 
00368   max = min;
00369   for (int i = 1; i < count; i++)
00370   {
00371     T value;
00372     if (abssolute)
00373       value = imAbs(map[i]);
00374     else
00375       value = map[i];
00376 
00377     if (value > max)
00378       max = value;
00379     else if (value < min)
00380       min = value;
00381   }
00382 }
00383 
00384 /** Calculates minimum and maximum values 
00385  * with addtional considerations for data type conversion and normalized operations.
00386  * \ingroup math */
00387 template <class T> 
00388 inline void imMinMaxType(const T *map, int count, T& min, T& max, int abssolute = 0)
00389 {
00390   int size_of = sizeof(imbyte);
00391   if (sizeof(T) == size_of)
00392   {
00393     /* for imbyte is always the maximum interval */
00394     min = 0;
00395     max = 255;
00396   }
00397   else
00398   {
00399     imMinMax(map, count, min, max, abssolute);
00400 
00401     /* if equal define a minimum interval */
00402     if (min == max)
00403     {
00404       max = min + 1;
00405 
00406       if (min != 0)
00407         min = min - 1;
00408     }
00409   }
00410 }
